Reviews.Title: “Very good if you go for one of the larger rooms”
Reviews.Author: Englishtravelfanatic
Reviews.Content: This trip was part business part pleasure and the hotel was selected by the company (they paid one night we paid the other). The location suited us - we are good walkers and walked to the Eiffel Tower, yet returning late at night we were pleased it was close to several Metro stations. The breakfast although expensive offered more choice than others I have experienced in France. The bed in the Executive room ( if they have special deals or a more spacious room is required - this is the best) was exceptionally comfortable. I agree with the reviewer that no plug in the washbasin is not good. I would suggest that light sleepers take earplugs because although this is in a very quiet area the poor soundproofing on the windows mean that the loud buzzing of motorbikes can clearly be heard. In general the staff were very friendly and helpful and put our suitcase in a locked, secure room on the day we vacated the hotel so we could pick it up later. A useful tip is if you have already purchased your Metro tickets walk down Rue Brunel and take the unmarked steps down underground in the small green area in the centre of Bd Pereire - this takes you to the RER station where you can continue underground to the Metro (good in bad weather).

Reviews.Title: “First time in Paris...”
Reviews.Author: Dagmar R
Reviews.Content: Last week, my husband and I went to Paris for the first time to celebrate New Year's. After researching many hotels, we decided to choose Villa Brunel based on other people's reviews and pictures. We are so happy we chose this hotel because it definitely fulfilled our expectations. It's a beautiful "boutique hotel". The room was very comfortable and a good size for me and my husband. The location of this hotel couldn't be better...it's a few minutes away (walking distance) from the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees. The guys at the concierge/front desk are great! They all are very nice, speak English and helped us with everything we needed. Renaud was very patient and took extra time to explain to us how to take the metro, plus made our reservation to the Lido show as well. So, he went above and beyond his work duties. I am definitely staying in this hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “A well-placed boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: CesmeTraveller
Reviews.Content: Villa Brunel is very well placed if you are attending an event at the Palais de Congres in Paris as it is only about 200m away. The rooms are generally small, but air conditioned and well appointed and the hotel boasts free WiFi. My only gripe was with the stylish wash-hand basin in the bathroom which has no plug and no way to stop the water running away, which seems very anti-Green in this day and age. However, it was made up for by a double-sized shower. Very good breakfast offering at €12 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in Paris - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Cory K
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in August, and it was exactly right for 2 people. The bathrooms are a little small, but manageable, the bed was comfortable and the staff were great. Staff lent us a converter for our camera charger when we forgot it in Belgium, and at no cost! Really quite a charming place and very well kept. Nice and quiet. There's a small flatscreen in the room, closet and desk. Everything has been recently renovated, so it looks good inside the rooms as well as the hotel itself. There are places to eat just around the corner, a grocery store about a 5 minute walk away, and a metro station even closer. Arc de Triomphe is only about a 10 minute walk, and really, you can walk everywhere you want (almost) from here. We hit almost every major stop in Paris and we did it on foot. this place being where it was made everything perfect - you could be in the centre of everything in 5-10 minutes, but you were also out of the way enough that it was peacefully quiet when you wanted it to be. Make sure you try the sandwiches and baguettes from the bakery where the small traffic circle is. we often got bread from there and groceries from down the street and just ate in the hotel room, which they did not have an issue with. I would definitely suggest this place, as I would stay here again myself. My only tip: If you are larger than 6 feet and around 190 lbs, you might find great issue with the bathroom space if you're in a room like we were. Everything was manageable, but people bigger than I am might find it uncomfortable maneuvering in the shower or getting around the toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: pajuriomergaite
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel for it's location: 5 min walk from porte maillot and 10 to arc de triumphe! It was clean, nice, modern, had a.c. As everyone mentioned before - very small bathroom, but it wasn't a problem for us. Vey comfortable bed. Would go back, even though it's quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but extremely small bathroom”
Reviews.Author: b0h0l
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a block away from metro so its very convenient to go around paris. It is very clean and room we stayed in is modern in design. However the bathroom is very small. Am a regular size asian woman but I find it difficult to move in the bathroom shower enclosure. Am sure a big size person will not fit in there. the arc de triumphe is a short walk away. There are many good bakeries, cafes and restaurants around the hotel. I strongly recommend taking your breakfast there. The restaurant Le Maison (or something) serves very good food. Go early because the tables fill up fast!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: RachelleV
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for access to the Arc de Triomphe and close to the double-decker sight seeing tours. We arrived to find out our bed sheets hadn't been changed - filthy with hair, stains etc. How they handled the situation was filled with arrogance and lack of understanding. They even asked us to change the sheets because their was no housekeeping staff. There was no manager available to deal with us the entire stay and the staff really lacked basic customer service skills. The posted rate on this hotel was 200 Euros per night and for the service it wasn't worth $20. Rachelle in Alberta

Reviews.Title: “Young couple stayed for two nights”
Reviews.Author: Megopie
Reviews.Content: I was so pleasantly surprised! What a gem! My boyfriend and I stayed two nights and it was amazing! Windows open up to the street and it's quiet. Air conditioning so it was nice and cool (you can set the temperature yourself) ya the bathroom is small but very nice!! The beds are very comfy and pillows are above average! When we came in there was th sweetest woman helping us and answered any question about the area. If you are coming from the airport take the metro! Take number 2 (dark blue) to the number 1 (yellow) it brings u right to the hotel! I can't say enough about this great hotel! There is a bike station right across the street and plenty of good restaurants! A short walk to the arc de Truimph and a 15 min bike ride to Eiffel tower! (look online to get a bike codes if u don't have a sim card in ur credit or debit card) loved this hotel! And will for sure stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “a bit off - but nice”
Reviews.Author: Ariam_10
Reviews.Content: small sweet hotel behind the conrgess centre. Clean rooms and good service. Small bakery with great croissants and baguettes just 100 meters away - so skip the breakfast offer in the hotel and go outside for breakfast. Asked hotel reception for local restaurants and found a gem in L'Maison

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful modern hotel in excellent location by Arc de Triumph”
Reviews.Author: birkel_lindsey
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this updated hotel in the heart of Paris. The rooms were large by Paris-standards and the conceirge was extremely helpful. The hotel is located just steps away from two metro stops and is well-positioned for visits to the Arc de Triumph, Champs-Elyasses and more. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very good position”
Reviews.Author: Beatrix81
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at this hotel, I really appreciated the position (close to the Arc de Triomphe and to the Champes Elysees, one of the best spot in Paris). The hotel has recently been renewed, room and furnitures were very nice and clean,the bathroom was new and quite big; It didn't look like an hotel you can find in every part of the world, it was very characteristc wiht bamboo seats and glass tables. If you want to be in a good position to visit paris and don't want to stay in a "standard" hotel but in a special one, go to this place.

Reviews.Title: “a mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: GraceyH
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is located wonderfully. The rooms have a number of charming parisian features however this is let down by the cleanliness of the room, which is not at all up to standard. The television is mainly french speaking channels with very bad reception. Otherwise the hotel is within walking distance of all the main attractions from the Louvre to being right next the the Arc de Triomphe.he wireless internet available in rooms is not so, in that a subscription to a Parisian internet provider is requird and password. The night staff reception was not the most helpful of people nor in fact were any of the staff, but the first impression of a place is the receptionist that serves you and we had terribly infringed upon his midnight telephone conversation. French must be attempted as with all other businesses in Paris but at a hotel I would expect lenancy towards other languages, and in particular english. Paris is one of my favourite cities so the hotel was a good budget and starting point. If it could spruce up its rooms, employ friendly staff and staff that work, it has extremely good potential.

Reviews.Title: “very nice - with some restrictions”
Reviews.Author: kellerkind
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the good things: The location is great (see other reviews), very near to the metro (Porte Maillot and Argentine) or Arc de Triomphe. The staff is really friendly. I had contact to the front desk manager, other concierges and the "night guy" and all were really nice and helpful! Check-in and Check-out were very easy without unpleasant surprisings. The room was very nice and looked somehow French. My colleagues were in other hotels in the surrounding and compared to the others it was the most individual and beautiful one. Now the Wireless Lan worked very well on the ground floor (what is a minus at the same time). Now the restrictions: The bathroom is very small. But maybe other rooms have bigger ones. On the other hand it was quite new and always clean. While it was very hot outside during my stay, the room was as well. It was not so easy to find sleep: whith an open window, one could hear all the noise from the street, what seemingly occurs during hot summer nights. My earplugs worked here very well. A minibar would have been great. To conclude: A nice hotel. It has some tiny details missing, but compared to the hotels of my colleagues it seemd more french and individual (and cheaper than other 3*hotels).

Reviews.Title: “Great price, location, manager”
Reviews.Author: Tamiqua
Reviews.Content: We got a wonderful deal on this hotel via Expedia. For 100 U.S. dollars per night in Europe, your options of course are quite limited nowadays. So this was a pleasant surprise. The hotel is a 5 min. walk away from the main metro route to the heart of the city. Our room was bigger than expected with a newly tiled bath and an actual closet (!) adjoining the bath. The maid did a great job cleaning the room. Most importantly is the front desk manager. After arriving in Paris from the States we took the metro to the hotel. As soon as we arrived, my husband realized he was the victim of a pickpocket who stole his wallet containing all of our credit cards, ATM card, and most of our cash (but not our passports!). The front desk manager assisted us in cancelling the cards and getting one of them replaced, a lengthy task indeed. He was knowledgable, kind and professional at all times during our 3 day stay. In addition, he speaks English perfectly. I just can't say enough good things about the service in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blueglas
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed Hotel Palma for 4 nights. Location was good. 5 mins walk to Algentine metro station (unfortunately, it's been closed when we stayed), 10mins walk to Charles de Gaulle Etoi and Arc de Triomphe. 5min from Porte Maillot Air France Bus stop, but it's bit hard to find for the first time, so it's better to take a taxi. You can walk up there on the way back because you can walk toward Hilton Hotel (huge tower!) as a landmark. Receptionists were all different everyday, but they're all nice and friendly and helpful. Very quiet at night. The room was nicely decorated, but it was too hot! We're sweating all the time. Bathroom was clean. Cleaning person had not provided us new cups (disposable) and toilet rolls until we asked. Lift was very tiny, so barely two of us (we are not big!!) could fit in. Breakfast was not included, so we paid 10 euro for each person for just one day. There're croissant, pain au chocolat, toast, yogurt, orange juice, and hot chocolate. I think it's bit expensive for this quantity, yet croissant was delicious. There's a bakery in walking distance (3mins) and it's also delicious! There're chemist, restaurants, cheese shop and a small convenient store near the hotel. So it's very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: BadenPowell
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews above and after I came back I must say they are correct. Me and my wife we take our parents and everyone was pleased with the hotel, we definitely return. Location: 100 metres from Porte Maillot (bus, metro station). There you can also use the Airfrance cars that came and go from both airports to Porte Maillot (you can find them outside the airport and in front of the Hotel Meridien in Porte Maillot). The metro line 1, goes directly to the centre of the city in 10 minutes, can you say it's far from de city centre ? Of course not ! All around the hotel you just can find houses, therefore, the neighbourhood was very friendly and calm, and you don't have suspicious streets nearby. Because of the Congress Palace in Porte Maillot, you have there a shopping centre, with restaurants and cinema, but you can also find lots of nice restaurants in the street without lots of tourists. Hotel: Most of the hotels in Paris, like this one, are located in XIX century buildings, so rooms are small, and sometimes elevators very tiny. But I found it very comfortable and I had no problems with space. The "provence style" decoration is very pleasant and makes it looks as a countryside hotel. The continental breakfast is enough. Staffs were friendly and helpful. The hotel, sheets and everything was clean and in order. Price: What you get is what you pay; he is really a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 Star Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bizdean
Reviews.Content: Choice of 230 Euro convention hotel or 60 Euro weekend 95 Euro weekday rate at Palma. No choice Palma great for the price. Small single room but very clean with new bath. Wonderful Paris sidewalk cafes within easy walking distance. No tourists in the area. Close to Metro and busses. Would stay there again when I return to Paris.

HotelInfo.Name: Villa Brunel
HotelInfo.Address: 46 rue Brunel, 75017 Paris, France
